title: indeskyz
author: indeskyz
content: Unbank: Buy & Sell Bitcoin instantly at trusted retail locations or online at home. Use cash to Buy Bitcoin at over 13,000 Retail Locations across the United States. Sell your Bitcoin in our app and withdraw cash from ATMs at over 23,000 Retail Locations across the United States. We are a non-Custodial Crypto Currency Exchange and never hold your funds. We are licensed to operate in all states except Alabama, Alaska, New York, Washington, Vermont & Puerto Rico.Get started with as little as your name and phone number.https://apps.apple.com/us/app/unbank-buy-and-sell-bitcoin/id1587374229https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=world.unbank.unbankmobileappSell Bitcoin through the app for Cash Pickup at over 23,000 ATMs1)Find Location2)Input Desired Amount3)Send Crypto to Pay Invoice4) Receive Cash Pickup Code5) Redeem Cash at the selected LocationBuy Bitcoin through cash deposit at over 13,000+ locationsConvert Cash to Bitcoin1) Find Locations2) Add Cash Now3) Input Wallet Address4) Give Cash to cashier at selected Location5) Convert the cash deposited in-app to Bitcoin ORPurchase Crypto Currency with Cash at our 350-plus dedicated BATM kiosksSupported Assets for BATM kiosksBitcoin (BTC)Litecoin (LTC)Dogecoin (DOGE)Please visit our website for more details: https://unbankworld.com/Customer Support: For questions, assistance, or additional information Please Contact support@unbankworld.com

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: Quote from: https://unbankworld.com/America's First Bitcoin Cash NetworkThis is a little a confusing given that there is an altcoin called Bitcoin cash. Did you actually mean Bitcoin network or Bitcoin cash indeed?Quote from: https://unbankworld.com/Since 2014 we have placed hundreds of ATMs throughout the United States. We prioritized the importance of creating a network of user-friendly kiosks, backed by our partners and in house customer support team. We have over 40,000 locations that support buying and selling cryptocurrency with cash.This is surprising considering that I thought this service is still new. In fact, I just got to know about it today

comments.author: indeskyz
comments.body: Quote from: logfiles on September 26, 2022, 08:44:14 PMQuote from: https://unbankworld.com/America's First Bitcoin Cash NetworkThis is a little a confusing given that there is an altcoin called Bitcoin cash. Did you actually mean Bitcoin network or Bitcoin cash indeed?Quote from: https://unbankworld.com/Since 2014 we have placed hundreds of ATMs throughout the United States. We prioritized the importance of creating a network of user-friendly kiosks, backed by our partners and in house customer support team. We have over 40,000 locations that support buying and selling cryptocurrency with cash.This is surprising considering that I thought this service is still new. In fact, I just got to know about it todayÂ  Thanks for taking a look. Where does it say we are America's First Bitcoin Cash Network? We only allow users to buy and sell Bitcoin, not Bitcoin cash.We've been operating Bitcoin ATMs (cash-in to Buy) since 2014 but our cashout product (Sell) with AllPoint ATMs at their 23,000+ locations is a new service that we offer. We don't charge any fees to sell your Bitcoin and withdraw cash from an ATM.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Quote from: indeskyz Please visit our website for more details: https://unbankworld.com/Can we also get a confirmation that this website is connected to http://www.unbank.world? As per coinatmradar, it is the main website (for the atms), see: https://coinatmradar.com/operator/183/unbank-bitcoin-atm-operator/.Maybe link it to the main website or post it using the official twitter account?

comments.author: indeskyz
comments.body: Quote from: Potato Chips on September 27, 2022, 05:07:53 AMQuote from: indeskyz Please visit our website for more details: https://unbankworld.com/Can we also get a confirmation that this website is connected to http://www.unbank.world? As per coinatmradar, it is the main website (for the atms), see: https://coinatmradar.com/operator/183/unbank-bitcoin-atm-operator/.Maybe link it to the main website or post it using the official twitter account?Yes, www.unbank.world is our old website that we are transitioning off of. We've also purchased unbank.com from a defunct bank and won't have access to that until the new year. I've changed our profile here to support@unbank.world so anyone that views our profile can contact us directly. Try us out, no fees when cashing out your Bitcoin and withdrawing cash from 23,000+ locations!
